radiographic_examinations.findings: Severe genu valgum of the right knee with a hip-knee-ankle angle (HKAa) of valgus 29.0°, grade IV osteoarthritic changes in the lateral femorotibial compartment according to the Kellgren-Lawrence classification, and laterally dislocated patella.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: At postoperative day 21, the HKAa was valgus 16° on the right and left knees. At 1-year follow-up, HKAa was valgus 13° and 17° on the right and left knees, respectively. Annual follow-up showed HKAa of valgus 11° and 16° on the right and left knees, respectively. At the latest follow-up (5 years), HKAa was still valgus 11° and 17° on the right and left knees, respectively.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Tibial tuberosity to trochlear groove distance of 41.3 mm.
Dysplasia of the trochlea with a sulcus angle of 150° and laterally located patella.
